intro: Crotalaria atrorubens, commonly known as black-red crownflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking dark red to black flowers that bloom in dense clusters, often with a yellowish throat. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability. Crotalaria atrorubens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
